text: In this video,
we will show you two different ways
you can make an elevator in Minecraft,
including how to make a water elevator
and a redstone elevator.
Elevators are a great and fun way
to try out different mechanics of building
and reach higher areas.

Start by creating two glass
tubes using glass blocks
and build it up for the level you want.
At the bottom and top,
make sure to leave a two-block gap,

so you're able to enter
and exit the elevator.
Place two signs in front of each opening.
This will stop the water from flowing out.

Add water into each tube
from the top of the elevator.

Then place kelp all the way
to the top in each tube.
After placing the kelp,
break the bottom kelp on each side
to remove them.
This will make the water-flowing blocks
into water source blocks.
On the right side of the elevator
will be the way up,
and the left side will be the way down.

In order to create a
way up and a way down,
you will need a block of soul sand
and a magma block.
Replace the bottom block on the right
using soul sand to create the way up.
And place the magma block on the left side
for the way down.

Start by creating three
two-block holes in a line.
Make the third block towards the back
a block lower,
and break a block on each side,

which will eventually
look like a cross shape.

Add redstone on the two
blocks next to each other,
then add a redstone lamp in the middle.
Use the block of your choice
and add it towards the front
with a stone button on it.

Add an observer on top
of the redstone lamp
and a slime block on top of that.
Then add a sticky piston
on either side of the slime block

and two slime blocks
on top of each piston.
Make sure there aren't any blocks
sticking to the slime blocks.
Add an upside-down sticky piston
on top of the middle slime block
and an upside-down observer
on top of that piston.
Close the gap in the middle

and add two blocks on top
of each other on either side
to hide the slime blocks behind.
Next, we're going to work
on the top part of the elevator.
Build four blocks up,

and then add obsidian above
the observer block below.
Add a redstone lamp under the obsidian.
Place three blocks in front of the lamp
and add a stone button in the middle,
and that's it for the top.
You can now use the blocks of your choice
to create a design for the elevator
and improve its look.
While you're building the design,

you must add two obsidian
blocks on top of each other

to the right and left
side of the elevator.

Make sure that the top
block of the obsidian
is at the same level as the redstone lamp.
Break the blocks under the obsidian.
Build two pillars leading
to the bottom part of the elevator.

Now you can improve the look
of the elevator on the bottom.

You can place some glowstone
inside the elevator
to add some light.

Build a gap using glass
all the way to the top.
And now your elevator is finished.
